member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.I2of5Encoder
member.summary: A class that encodes data into Interleaved 2 of 5 barcodes.
member.remarks: Interleaved 2 of 5 is a symbology that is commonly used in industry. It is related to Standard 2 of 5 (See ), except instead of encoding each digit as a series of bars of varying widths, Interleaved 2 of 5 encodes pairs of digits as a series of bars and spaces. It is also the basis for ITF14. Interleaved 2 of 5 can only encode digit strings of even length.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.I2of5Encoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded in Interleaved 2 of 5, as a text string.
member.remarks: Interleaved 2 of 5 can only encode even-length digit strings. However, this encoder will accept odd-length digit strings. If the digit string's length is odd, the encoder will add a mod-10 check digit the end, to make the completed string even-length. The checksum is calculated by multiplying the rightmost digit by 3, the next digit by 1, the third digit by 3, and so on. The digits are then summed; the check digit is the value that must be added to reach the next multiple of ten.
member.exception: The data supplied to the encoder contains non-digit symbols. The property will be set to "Digit".

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.I2of5Encoder.Flags
member.summary: Gets flags that represent the encoder's capabilities.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.I2of5Encoder.TextSymbols
member.summary: Symbols that are encodable by this encoder.
member.remarks: This encoder can only encode digits. If any non-digit symbols are passed in, the encoder will fail.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.I2of5Encoder.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.S2of5Encoder
member.summary: A class that encodes data into Standard (Industrial) 2 of 5 barcodes.
member.remarks: Standard 2 of 5 is a symbology that is commonly used in industry. It encodes digits in patterns consisting of five bars per digit, with two of the five bars thicker than the other three (hence, 2 of 5). While it is larger than Interleaved 2 of 5, it can encode an odd number of digits.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.S2of5Encoder.UseChecksum
member.summary: Gets or sets whether a checksum digit should be appended to the barcode.
member.value: True if a checksum digit should be appended, false otherwise.

remarks.para: The checksum digit is calculated by weighting the digits in odd positions (rightmost, third to rightmost, etc.) with a weight of three, and even-positioned digits a weight of one. The digits are then summed, and the check digit is the value that must be added to reach the next multiple of ten.
If the value of this property is changed after the data has been set, the data will be re-encoded to include or exclude the check digit.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.S2of5Encoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded in Standard (Industrial) 2 of 5, as a text string.
member.remarks: Standard 2 of 5 can only encode digits. If is true, a checksum digit will be appended. The checksum is calculated by multiplying the rightmost digit by 3, the next digit by 1, the third digit by 3, and so on. The digits are then summed; the check digit is the value that must be added to reach the next multiple of ten.
member.exception: The data supplied to the encoder contains non-digit symbols. The property will be set to "Digit".

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.S2of5Encoder.Flags
member.summary: Gets flags that represent the encoder's capabilities.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.S2of5Encoder.TextSymbols
member.summary: Symbols that are encodable by this encoder.
member.remarks: The encoder can only encode digits. If any non-digit symbols are passed in, the encoder will fail.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.S2of5Encoder.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: The base sizing class for the two 2 of 5 symbologies.
member.remarks: The two 2 of 5 symbologies' sizing requirements are virtually identical, with the only difference being the size of each digit's encoding.

member.summary: The module width of the barcode, in pixels.

member.summary: The guard (quiet) zone width, in pixels.
member.remarks: If the flag is set, this width also includes a 5 module wide black stripe, for the left and right sides of the box.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Base2of5Sizer.Length
member.summary: The length of the encoded data, in digits.
member.remarks: This is used by the derived classes in their implementation of .

member.summary: The total width of the barcode, excluding any guard (quiet) zones, in pixels.

member.summary: The total width of the barcode, in pixels, given the current DPI and module width.

member.summary: Gets the font height used for numbering the barcode.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Base2of5Sizer.FontHeightAddon
member.summary: The extra space added to the bottom of the barcode, for space to number the barcode.
member.value: The extra space, in pixels, at the bottom of the barcode.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Base2of5Sizer.TopWidth
member.summary: Gets the width of the top bracer bar, if present, in pixels.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Base2of5Sizer.BottomWidth
member.summary: Gets the width of the bottom bracer bar, if present, and the numbering, in pixels.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Base2of5Sizer.SideBrace
member.summary: Gets the width of the left and right side bracing bars, in pixels.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Base2of5Sizer.Height
member.summary: The minimum height of the barcode, in pixels.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Base2of5Sizer.ExtraHeight
member.summary: The height of all items added to the barcode.
member.value: The height of all items added to the barcode, in pixels.

remarks.para: For 2 of 5 barcodes, the extra height comes from text at the bottom of the barcode, and the optional bracing or boxing of the barcode symbol.
This property is meant to be used to generate a desired barcode height. To calculate the height of the size to pass to , multiply the desired height (in inches) by the DPI, and add this number to it.
This property's value is potentially impacted by the value of . The barcode render mode flags should be set before using this value.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.Base2of5Sizer.IsValidSize(System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Checks to see if a specified size is valid.
member.param: A size to test for validity.
member.returns: True if this size may be passed to , false otherwise.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.Base2of5Sizer.GetValidSize(System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Given a size, returns the largest valid size contained by that size.
member.param: A maximum size, from which to find a valid size.
member.returns: A valid size which may be passed to the .
member.exception: The specified size is smaller than the minimum size in one or both dimensions.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Base2of5Sizer.DPI
member.summary: The current DPI (dots-per-inch) of the barcode.
member.value: The current DPI (dots-per-inch) of the barcode.
member.remarks:
This value represents the DPI that the barcode will be printed at. This value defaults to zero, which represents "logical" mode. In "logical" mode, the generated barcode represents the relative sizing and positioning of barcode elements, but they are not necessarily in the proper size for printing.
If the value is greater than zero, the barcode generator will generate a barcode using the specified DPI.
member.exception: When setting the DPI, the value specified was less than zero.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Base2of5Sizer.Mode
member.summary: The rendering mode flags, which control the way the barcode is rendered.
member.value: The flags which control which aspects of the barcode are rendered.
member.remarks: The 2 of 5 encoders recognize all rendering flags except . Setting the flag automatically sets the flag.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Base2of5Sizer.Module
member.summary: Gets and sets module width of the barcode (in mils).
member.value: The module width of the barcode, in mils (1 mil is 1/1000 of an inch). The default value is 10 mils (.254 mm).
member.remarks: The module width is the width of the narrowest bar. The widths of spaces, wide bars, wide spaces, quiet zones, etc. are multiples of this module width. Changing the module width of a barcode changes the total width of the barcode, as returned by .
member.exception: The specified module width is less than .

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Base2of5Sizer.MinimumModule
member.summary: Gets the minimum module width, in mils.
member.value: The minimum module width, in mils. (1 mil is 1/1000th of an inch, or .025mm). Always returns 7.5 mils (.19 mm).

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.I2of5Generator
member.summary: Class which generates Interleaved 2 of 5 barcodes.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.I2of5Generator.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the byte array of encoded data used by the generator to generate the barcode.
member.value: The byte array of encoded data.
member.remarks: This data only has very basic validation to ensure that it does not cause exceptions when used (such as array overruns). It is not checked for validity. The user should not set this directly, instead, it should be set by an encoder class. This property does not make a copy of the byte array that is supplied to it, it only keeps a reference. The generator's behavior if the underlying byre array is modified, is undefined.
member.exception: The specified byte array is invalid, in either length or content.

member.summary: Gets the barcode generator capability flags.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeUtilities.CalculateModuleWidth(ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeModularSizer,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the module width for a given barcode, with a default tolerance and approach direction.
member.remarks: This routine is the equivilent to a call of (, , false, .1f). It returns a module width that produces a barcode that is as close to the target as possible, but no larger.
member.param: The sizer instance for the barcode to be sized.
member.returns: A module width which produces a barcode as close to the target as possible, but no larger.
member.exception: The specified pixel width is smaller than the smallest possible width, as calculated with a module width of .
The specified is null.
The is set to zero.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeUtilities.CalculateModuleWidth(ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeModularSizer,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Calculates the module width for a given barcode, with a default tolerance.
member.remarks: This routine is the equivilent to a call of (, , , .1f).
member.param: The sizer instance for the barcode to be sized.

True to return the module width that produces a width as close as possible to but not less than the specified width, false to return a module width as close as possible but not greater than the specified width.
member.returns: A module width, which produces a barcode as close to the target as possible, but no larger or smaller, depending on .
member.exception: The specified pixel width is smaller than the smallest possible width, as calculated with a module width of .
The specified is null.
The is set to zero.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeUtilities.CalculateModuleWidth(ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeModularSizer,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: Calculates the module width for a given barcode.
member.param: The sizer instance for the barcode to be sized.

True to return the module width that produces a width as close as possible to but not less than the specified width, false to return a module width as close as possible but not greater than the specified width.
The desired module tolerance; once calculations narrow the module rande to a distance lower than this, calculations stop.
member.returns: A module width, which produces a barcode as close to the target as possible, but no larger or smaller, depending on .
member.exception: The specified pixel width is smaller than the smallest possible width, as calculated with a module width of , or is less than 0.01.
The specified is null.
The is set to zero.

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeGeneratorFlags.Linear
member.summary: The barcode generated is a 1D linear barcode. This flag and are mutually exclusive.

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeGeneratorFlags.TwoDimensional
member.summary: The barcode generated is a 2D barcode. This flag and are mutually exclusive.

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeGeneratorFlags.HeightDependant
member.summary: The barcode's height is strictly dependant on the barcode's width. The Height parameter of any size passed to will be ignored.

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeGeneratorFlags.AspectRatio
member.summary: The barcode has a particular range of aspect ratios, Height/Width, that it must meet, as specified by and .

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeGeneratorFlags.VariableLength
member.summary: The barcode's width is dependant upon the data to be encoded. or must be set before obtaining a width from .

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeGeneratorFlags.FixedDimensions
member.summary: The barcode's dimensions are strictly dictated by the standard. The size passed into must be the size returned by .

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeRenderMode
member.summary: Flags that control rendering options for barcodes.
member.remarks: Certain flags are not used by certain generators. The flags that are used by a given generator will be specified in the generator's documentation. Furthermore, depending on the generator, setting some flags will set other flags.

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeRenderMode.None
member.summary: No options.

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeRenderMode.Guarded
member.summary: Include blank "guard" or "quiet" zones on each end of the barcode.

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeRenderMode.Notched
member.summary: Include notches in barcode, into which numbers can be drawn.

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeRenderMode.Numbered
member.summary: Include human-readable barcode information.

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeRenderMode.Braced
member.summary: Include "bearer bars", two horizontal bars at the top and bottom of the barcode, to prevent partial scans.

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeRenderMode.Boxed
member.summary: Put the barcode in a box, including guard zones.

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeEncoderFlags.Text
member.summary: The barcode can encode strings of particular characters. The data to be encoded is set in . The characters that can be used are specified in .

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeEncoderFlags.Data
member.summary: The barcode information to be encoded can be set with .

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeEncoderFlags.Binary
member.summary: The barcode can encode arbitrary binary data, set with .

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeEncoderFlags.ExtendedData
member.summary: The barcode encodes multi-byte data codes, set with .

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeEncoderFlags.ASCII

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeEncoderFlags.Composite
member.summary: The barcode encoder is a composite encoder. The generator used (as returned by ) and corresponding sizer, as returned by , might not set until the data to be encoded has been set, and might change after the data to be encoded changes.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeEncoder
member.summary: The main interface for a barcode encoder. The encoder encodes plaintext data into codes suitable for barcode generation by an .
member.remarks: This is the main interface that the library user interacts with. Under most circumstances, classes implementing should not be used directly.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeEncoder.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded by a barcode, as a byte array.
member.value: The byte data to be encoded.
member.exception: The encoder does not support directly setting the data to be encoded.
The data supplied to the encoder is invalid, either in length or in content. The message of the exception gives more information.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeEncoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded by a barcode, as a text string.
member.remarks: The value returned by this property is equal to the value passed in; it might not exactly represent the value encoded by the barcode. (For instance, in ISBN barcodes, dashes used to separate the ISBN are not encoded but will be retained and returned by this property.)
member.exception: The encoder does not support directly setting the data as a text string.
The data supplied to the encoder is invalid, either in length or in content. The message of the exception gives more information.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeEncoder.Flags
member.summary: Flags that represent the encoder's capabilities.
member.value: Flags that represent the encoder's capabilities.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeEncoder.TextSymbols
member.summary: Symbols that are encodable by this encoder.
member.value: The valid characters that may be encoded.
member.remarks: This returns a string containing all of the valid characters (or characters that might be encoded) appear in a string passed to . This does not mean that any arrangement of such characters are necessarily valid, or that other characters will cause an encoding error. (For instance, in , the valid characters are "0123456789xX". However, passing in an ISBN with dashes in it will not cause an error; the dashes are simply ignored.) The behavior of a given encoder will be described in the documentation of that encoder. This property is primarily for reference. This property only returns a value if the flag is set in .

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeEncoder.Generator
member.summary: Returns the generator being used by this encoder.
member.value: The generator being used by this encoder.
member.remarks: This property might return null if the encoder is a composite encoder and the data has not been set. The returned should not be saved, as it might change if the data to be encoded is changed.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeEncoder.Sizer
member.summary: Returns the sizer being used by this encoder.
member.value: The sizer for the generator being used by this encoder.
member.remarks: This property might return null if the encoder is a composite encoder and the data has not been set. The returned should not be saved, as it might change if the data to be encoded is changed.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeSizer
member.summary: Interface to the sizing controls of a barcode generator.
member.remarks: This interface contains two properties that directly affect the size of a generated barcode: they are and .

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeSizer.Width
member.summary: The width of the barcode.
member.value: The width of the barcode, in pixels.
member.remarks: This is a fixed value, in the sense that any generated barcode must have a width equal to this. The width can be modified by changing the value of , , and in the case of sizers implementing , .

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeSizer.Height
member.summary: The height of the barcode.
member.value: The height of the barcode, in pixels.
member.remarks: This typically represents the minimum height; a size passed to may (in most cases) have any height greater than or equal to this value. The height may be constrained by aspect ratio requirements. If the sizer's generator's value includes the flag, this value is the one that will be used by , regardless of the value passed in.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeSizer.ExtraHeight
member.summary: The height of all items added to the barcode.
member.value: The height of all items added to the barcode, in pixels.

remarks.para: This property is meant to be used to generate a desired barcode height. To calculate the height of the size to pass to , multiply the desired height (in inches) by the DPI, and add this number to it. This is also an important number in aspect ratio calculations; this number is subtracted from the barcode's specified height before the aspect ratio is checked, since the aspect ratio is meant for the barcode itself, not the extra text and guards that surround it.
This property's value is potentially impacted by the value of . The barcode render mode flags should be set before using this value.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeSizer.Size
member.summary: The current size of the barcode.
member.value: The current size of the barcode.
member.remarks: This varies given the current , , and (if implemented) values. If the sizer's generator's value includes the flag, this is the only valid size that may be passed to .

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeSizer.DPI
member.summary: The current DPI (dots-per-inch) of the barcode.
member.value: The current DPI (dots-per-inch) of the barcode.
member.remarks:
This value represents the DPI that the barcode will be printed at. This value defaults to zero, which represents "logical" mode. In "logical" mode, the generated barcode represents the relative sizing and positioning of barcode elements, but they are not necessarily in the proper size for printing.
If the value is greater than zero, the barcode generator will generate a barcode using the specified DPI.
member.exception: When setting the DPI, the value specified was less than zero, or, in the case of barcodes with strict dimensional requirements (such as Postnet), the requirements cannot be met with the specified DPI.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeSizer.AspectRatioMin
member.summary: The minimum ratio of height over width.
member.value: This is the minimum aspect ratio of height over width, or zero if there is no minimum.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeSizer.AspectRatioMax
member.summary: The maximum ratio of height over width.
member.value: This is the maximum aspect ratio of height over width, or zero if there is no maximum.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeSizer.Mode
member.summary: The rendering mode flags, which control the way the barcode is rendered.
member.value: The flags which control which aspects of the barcode are rendered.
member.remarks: The particular flags available depends on the barcode being generated. Any flags that are not available to a given barcode are ignored. Some barcode encoders may set default flags, depending on the standard. Some generators may set extra flags if certain flags are specified.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeSizer.IsValidSize(System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Checks to see if a specified size is valid.
member.param: A size to test for validity.
member.returns: True if this size may be passed to , false otherwise.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeSizer.GetValidSize(System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Given a size, returns the largest valid size contained by that size.
member.param: A maximum size, from which to find a valid size.
member.returns: A valid size which may be passed to .
member.exception: The specified size is smaller than the minimum size in one or both dimensions.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeModularSizer
member.summary: Interface to the sizing controls of a modular barcode generator. This interface includes a property to set modular width.
member.remarks: This interface contains three properties that directly affect the size of a generated barcode: they are , and .

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeModularSizer.Module
member.summary: Gets and sets module width of the barcode (in mils).
member.value: The module width of the barcode, in mils (1 mil is 1/1000 of an inch, or .0254 mm).
member.remarks: In a modular barcode, the module width is the width of the narrowest bar. The widths of spaces, wide bars, wide spaces, quiet zones, etc. are multiples of this module width. Changing the module width of a barcode changes the total width of the barcode, as returned by .
member.exception: The specified module width is less than .

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeModularSizer.MinimumModule
member.summary: The minimum module width of the barcode.
member.value: The minimum module width of the barcode, in mils (1 mil is 1/1000 of an inch, or .0254 mm).
member.remarks: The value of cannot be set lower than the value returned by this property.

member.summary: Gets the sizing controls for this barcode generator.

member.remarks: The returned object might also implement the , if the barcode generator generates a modular barcode.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.IBarcodeGenerator.Flags
member.summary: Gets the flags that represent the capabilities of the generator and its corresponding sizer.

member.summary: Generates a barcode of a specified size, using the data that has been set previously by its corresponding encoder.

member.exception: The specified size is invalid.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeEncoder
member.summary: A base implementation of the interface. The base class for most of the encoders in this library.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeEncoder.#ctor(ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeGenerator)
member.summary: Constructs a BarcodeEncoder.
member.param: The generator that this encoder uses.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeEncoder.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded into a barcode.
member.value: A byte array of data to be encoded.
member.remarks:
Not all encoders are capable of accepting byte arrays to be encoded. This property will store a copy of the byte array specified. The actual data encoded into the barcode might vary from the data provided, depending on the interpretation of the data provided, but the value returned by this property is the original byte array that it was set to.
The default implementation of this property is to throw a . Derived classes must override this property if they support setting data to be encoded via byte array.
member.exception: The encoder does not support setting the data to be encoded by byte array.
The data to be encoded is invalid, either by length or content.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeEncoder.EncodedData
member.summary: Gets the data sent to the generator, to be converted into a barcode.
member.value: A byte array of the data used by the generator, or null.
member.remarks: This is used primarily for debugging purposes. The default behavior of this property is to return the value of the property of the generator specified in the constructor, or set by , or null if the generator has not been set.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeEncoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to be encoded into a barcode.
member.value: A string of the data to be encoded.
member.remarks:
Not all encoders are capable of accepting strings to be encoded. This property will store a copy of the string specified. The actual data encoded into the barcode might vary from the data provided, depending on the interpretation of the data provided, but the value returned by this property is the original string that it was set to.
The default implementation of this property is to throw a . Derived classes must override this property if they support setting data to be encoded via string.
member.exception: The encoder does not support setting the data to be encoded by string.
The data to be encoded is invalid, either by length or content.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeEncoder.Flags
member.summary: Gets flags representing the capabilities of the encoder, as described in .
member.value: Flags representing the capabilities of the encoder.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeEncoder.TextSymbols
member.summary: Gets a string containing the symbols that can be encoded.
member.value: A string containing the symbols that can be encoded, or null.
member.remarks:
This return a string of encodable symbols, if the flag is set, otherwise it returns null. This property only acts as a guide, because the presence of symbols that are not in this string, does not necessarily cause encoding to fail.
The default behavior is to return null.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeEncoder.Generator
member.summary: Gets the generator associated with this encoder.
member.value: The generator associated with this encoder, or null if a generator has not been set.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeEncoder.GeneratorInstance
member.summary: Gets or sets the generator associated with this encoder.
member.value: The generator associated with this encoder.
member.remarks: This property differs from because this both allows the generator to be set, and returns the generator as an instance of instead of an instance of . It is for internal use by encoders that change their generator depending on their data (composite encoders).

member.summary: Gets the sizer associated with the generator, associated with this encoder.

member.summary: The height of all items added to the barcode.

remarks.para: This property is meant to be used to generate a desired barcode height. To calculate the height of the size to pass to , multiply the desired height (in inches) by the DPI, and add this number to it. This is also an important number in aspect ratio calculations; this number is subtracted from the barcode's specified height before the aspect ratio is checked, since the aspect ratio is meant for the barcode itself, not the extra text and guards that surround it.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeSizer.Size
member.summary: The current size of the barcode.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.BarcodeSizer.DPI
member.summary: The current DPI (dots-per-inch) of the barcode.
member.value: The current DPI (dots-per-inch) of the barcode.
member.remarks:
This value represents the DPI that the barcode will be printed at. This value defaults to zero, which represents "logical" mode. In "logical" mode, the generated barcode represents the relative sizing and positioning of barcode elements, but they are not necessarily in the proper size for printing.
If the value is greater than zero, the barcode generator will generate a barcode using the specified DPI.
Derived classes can override the DPI property to capture changes to the DPI, in order to recalculate sizing information.

member.remarks: This data only has very basic validation to ensure that it does not cause exceptions when used (such as array overruns). It is not checked for validity. The user should not set this directly, instead, it should be set by an encoder class. This property does not make a copy of the byte array that is supplied to it, it only keeps a reference. The generator's behavior if the underlying byre array is modified, is undefined.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodabarEncoder
member.summary: An encoder that generates Codabar barcodes.
member.remarks: Codabar is a barcode symbology commonly used in blood banks, photo labs, etc. It can encode the digits 0-9, the letters A, B, C, and D, which act as mandatory start and stop characters, and the symbols dash (-), dollar ($), colon (:), slash (/), dot (.), and plus (+).

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodabarEncoder.Data
member.summary: Not supported.
member.remarks: Always throws a exception.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodabarEncoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to be encoded into a barcode.
member.value: A string of the data to be encoded.
member.remarks: A valid Codabar barcode must begin with an A, B, C, or D, and must end with an A, B, C, or D, though the start and end do not have to be the same. A, B, C, and D can only appear as the first and last characters. The symbols between the start and stop symbols, can only be the following: 0-9, dash (-), dollar ($), colon (:), slash (/), dot (.), and plus (+). The string is converted to uppercase when it is encoded, but the string returned by this property will have the same case as the string passed in.
member.exception: The encoder does not support setting the data to be encoded by string.
The data to be encoded is invalid, either by length or content.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodabarEncoder.Flags
member.summary: Gets flags that represent the encoder's capabilities.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodabarEncoder.TextSymbols
member.summary: Symbols that are encodable by this encoder.
member.remarks: The encoder can only encode these symbols. Passing in a symbol that is not in this string will cause the encoder to fail. A, B, C, and D are start and stop symbols. They can and must appear only at the beginning and end of the data to be encoded..

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodabarEncoder.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.remarks: This property is used by to inform it of the size of the encoded barcode, since the module length of individual symbols varies depending on the symbol. It should not be set directly.

member.summary: The current DPI (dots-per-inch) of the barcode.
member.value: The current DPI (dots-per-inch) of the barcode.
member.remarks:
This value represents the DPI that the barcode will be printed at. This value defaults to zero, which represents "logical" mode. In "logical" mode, the generated barcode represents the relative sizing and positioning of barcode elements, but they are not necessarily in the proper size for printing.
If the value is greater than zero, the barcode generator will generate a barcode using the specified DPI.
member.exception: When setting the DPI, the value specified was less than zero.

member.summary: The total width of the barcode, excluding any guard (quiet) zones, in pixels.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodabarSizer.Width

member.summary: Gets the font height used for numbering the barcode.

member.summary: The extra space added to the bottom of the barcode, for space to number the barcode.

member.summary: The minimum height of the barcode, in pixels.

member.summary: The height of all items added to the barcode.

This property is meant to be used to generate a desired barcode height. To calculate the height of the size to pass to , multiply the desired height (in inches) by the DPI, and add this number to it.
This property's value is potentially impacted by the value of . The barcode render mode flags should be set before using this value.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodabarSizer.Module
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired module width, in mils.
member.value: The current desired module width, in mils (1 mil is 1/1000th of an inch, .0254 mm). The default value is 10 mils (.25 mm).
member.remarks: The barcode generator will generate a barcode with a module width that is as close as possible to, but not smaller than, the specified module width, within the limits of the specified DPI. It cannot be set lower than the value returned by .
member.exception: The specified module width is smaller than .

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodabarSizer.MinimumModule
member.summary: Gets the minimum module width, in mils.
member.value: The minimum module width, in mils. (1 mil is 1/1000th of an inch, or .025mm). Always returns 7.5 mils (.19 mm).

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodabarGenerator

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodabarGenerator.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the byte array of encoded data used by the generator to generate the barcode.
member.value: The byte array of encoded data.
member.remarks: This data only has very basic validation to ensure that it does not cause exceptions when used (such as array overruns). It is not checked for validity. The user should not set this directly, instead, it should be set by an encoder class. This property does not make a copy of the byte array that is supplied to it, it only keeps a reference. The generator's behavior if the underlying byre array is modified, is undefined.
member.exception: The specified byte array is invalid, in either length or content.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code11Encoder
member.summary: An encoder that generates Code 11 barcodes.
member.remarks: Code 11 is commonly used in telecommunications equipment; it is capable of encoding the digits 0-9 and the dash (-) symbol. It is not a secure symbology, in the sense that it is possible for a printing error to convert one valid symbol into another, so the use of one or two check digits is recommended. If the property is set to true, the encoder will append one or two check digits, depending on the length of the data.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code11Encoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded by a barcode, as a text string.
member.remarks: Code 11 can only encode strings containing digits and dashes (-).
member.exception: The data supplied to the encoder contains characters other than 0-9 and dash (-). The property will be set to "Digit".

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code11Encoder.Flags
member.summary: Gets flags that represent the encoder's capabilities.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code11Encoder.TextSymbols
member.summary: Symbols that are encodable by this encoder.
member.remarks: This encoder can only encode digits and the dash (-) symbol. If any other symbols are passed in, the encoder will fail.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code11Encoder.AppendChecksum
member.summary: Gets or sets whether checksum digits should be appended to the encoded data.
member.value: True if checksum digits should be appended, false otherwise.

remarks.para: If this is set to true, the encoder will append one checksum digit if the data length is 9 digits or less, and two checksum characters if the length is ten or more.

The first digit appended is called the 'C' digit; it is calculated by weighting the data digits, from right to left, with a value of 1 for the rightmost digit, two for the next digit, etc. After the digits are weighted, they are summed, and the sum modulo 11 is used as the first check digit.

The second check digit, if used, is called the 'K' digit. Its calculation is similar to the 'C' digit, except the 'C' digit is the included as the first digit (weighted at 1), and the check digit is the remainder modulo 10 instead of modulo 9.
If the value of this property is changed after the data has been set, the data will be re-encoded to include or exclude the check digits.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code11Encoder.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code39Encoder
member.summary: An encoder that generates Code 39 barcodes.

remarks.para: Code 39 is a very commonly used barcode, found in many fields. It's standard form can encode the symbols 0-9, A-Z, as well as dash (-), dot (.), space ( ), dollar ($), slash (/), plus (+), and percent (%). It also has an extended form, which is capable of encoding all 128 of the lower ASCII symbols. The encoder will not automatically switch to the extended encoding if extended characters are detected; this must be enabled by setting the to true.
Code 39 barcodes don't normally require a checksum digit, but if the property is set to true, the encoder will automatically add a mod 43 checksum digit.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code39Encoder.UseExtended
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the encoder should detect and encode characters of the full ASCII set
member.value: True if extended characters will be encoded, false otherwise. Defaults to false.
member.remarks: Changing this property's value does not re-encode text or data that was set before the property's value was set. You must set this property before setting the text or data. If this property is false, and extended characters are detected, the encoder will throw an exception.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code39Encoder.AddChecksum
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the encoder should append a check digit.
member.value: True if a check digit should be appended, false otherwise.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code39Encoder.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded into a barcode.
member.value: A byte array of data to be encoded.
member.remarks: The byte values in the byte array are encoded as their corresponding ASCII characters. If any byte contains a value above 127, an will be thrown. Likewise, if the byte array contains values outside of the standard encoding system (0-9, A-Z, -. $/+%), and is false, an will be thrown.
member.exception: The data to be encoded contains values above 127, or contains extended characters and is false. The property will contain the values "Invalid" or "Extended", respectively.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code39Encoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded by a barcode, as a text string.
member.remarks: Code 39 can encode the entire lower ASCII set (0-127), but it will fail if is false and a character other than (0-9, A-Z, and "-. $/+%"), is encountered.
member.exception: The string to be encoded contains values outside the lower ASCII set, or contains extended characters and is false. The property will contain the values "Invalid" or "Extended", respectively.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code39Encoder.TextSymbols
member.summary: Returns the list of standard (non-extended) Code 39 characters.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code39Encoder.Flags
member.summary: Gets flags that represent the encoder's capabilities.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code39Encoder.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code93Encoder
member.summary: An encoder that generates Code 93 barcodes.

remarks.para: Code 93 is a continuous variant of Code 39. It's standard form can encode the symbols 0-9, A-Z, as well as dash (-), dot (.), space ( ), dollar ($), slash (/), plus (+), and percent (%), as with Code 39. It also has an extended form, which is capable of encoding all 128 of the lower ASCII symbols, but unlike Code 39, the extended form is easily integrated into barcodes and does not require a separate property to be set.
Code 93 barcodes require two checksum digits; the encoder will automatically add two mod-47 based checksum digits.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code93Encoder.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded into a barcode.
member.value: A byte array of data to be encoded.
member.remarks: The byte values in the byte array are encoded as their corresponding ASCII characters. If any byte contains a value above 127, an will be thrown.
member.exception: The data to be encoded contains values above 127. The property will contain the value "Invalid".

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code93Encoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded by a barcode, as a text string.
member.remarks: Code 39 can encode the entire lower ASCII set (0-127).
member.exception: The data to be encoded contains values outside the lower ASCII set. The property will contain the value "Invalid".

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code93Encoder.Flags
member.summary: Gets flags that represent the encoder's capabilities.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code93Encoder.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code128EncodingMode
member.summary: These Code128 encoding modes control the codeset used to encode data.
member.remarks: The encoding mode must be passed as a parameter to the constructor. It cannot be set after the class has been initialized.

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code128EncodingMode.Auto
member.summary: The encoder will use all three encoding sets, switching between the three to produce the shortest possible barcode. This is the default mode and should be used unless there is a reason to only encode in one encoding.

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code128EncodingMode.A
member.summary: The encoder will only use the A encoding set. This set can encode any valid ASCII data, but may result in a longer barcode than using Auto.

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code128EncodingMode.B
member.summary: The encoder will only use the B encoding set. This set can encode any valid ASCII data, but may result in a longer barcode than using Auto.

member.name: F:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code128EncodingMode.C
member.summary: The encoder will only use the C encoding set. This set can only encode strings composed of an even number of digits, as well as the FNC1 function code. Passing any other data will result in an exception when encoding.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code128Encoder
member.summary: An encoder to encode data into Code128.
member.remarks: Code128 is a widely used barcode symbology, capable of encoding the entire lower ASCII set (0-127), as well as four control characters (FNC1-FNC4). Code128 has three separate encoding styles (A, B, and C), and can switch between them in the same barcode. Set A encodes ASCII characters 0-95, SetB encodes ASCII characters 32-127, and set C encodes all pairs of digits from 00 to 99. Code128 is the basis for EAN-128, and is used by , as well as HIBC and other topologies.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code128Encoder.EncodingMode
member.summary: Gets the encoding mode that the encoder is using.
member.value: The encoding mode that the encoder is using.
member.remarks: The encoding mode can only be set by passing it to the constructor.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code128Encoder.UseFunctionEscapes
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the text encoder recognizes function escape sequences.
member.value: True if the encoder will recognize function escapes, false otherwise.
member.remarks: For information about function escape sequences, see . Note that this property must be set before setting . If the value is changed after is set, the data will not be reencoded with the new value.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code128Encoder.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded into a barcode.
member.value: A byte array of data to be encoded.
member.remarks: The byte values in the byte array are encoded as their corresponding ASCII characters. The function codes FNC1-FNC4 are mapped to 128-131 respectively. If any byte contains a value above 131, an is thrown. Likewise, if the byte array is unencodable given the coding method () specified in the constructor.
member.exception: The data to be encoded contains values above 131, or the data cannot be encoded given the current encoding method. The property will contain the values "Invalid" or "Method", respectively.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code128Encoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to be encoded into a barcode.
member.value: A string of the data to be encoded.
member.remarks:
While the text string encoding method does not natively support encoding function codes, however, if the property is set to true, the encoder will interpret the following character escape sequences, as listed:
SequenceInterpretation
%1FNC1
%2FNC1
%3FNC1
%4FNC1
%%%
Note that the encoder will only recognize these sequences. Any other sequence involving percent signs will be passed through as-is.
member.exception: The text contains non-ASCII or high-ASCII (above 127) characters, or the data cannot be encoded given the current encoding method. The property will contain the values "Invalid" or "Method", respectively.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code128Encoder.Flags
member.summary: Gets flags that represent the encoder's capabilities.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code128Encoder.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, with the encoding mode set to .

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.Code128Encoder.#ctor(ActiveUp.WebControls.Code128EncodingMode)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, with the specified encoding mode.

member.summary: Returns the number of pixels in 1/4th of an inch (6.35 mm), given the current DPI.
member.remarks: This value is used as a minimum height by most of the Code N barcodes.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodeNSizer.ModuleWidth
member.summary: The module width of the barcode, in pixels.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodeNSizer.GuardWidth
member.summary: The guard (quiet) zone width, in pixels.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodeNSizer.CalculateSizes
member.summary: Method called to calculate the various sizes when DPI or Module Width is changed..
member.remarks: This mathod is called when or is changed, so that the derived class can set the , , and properties, as well as any other properties they need to set on their own.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodeNSizer.Length
member.summary: The length of the data being encoded.
member.remarks: This property is provided for derived classes to recieve information about the encoded data, from its corresponding generator. The property is not otherwise used by , and its usage is left to derived classes and their corresponding generators.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodeNSizer.DPI
member.summary: The current DPI (dots-per-inch) of the barcode.
member.value: The current DPI (dots-per-inch) of the barcode.
member.remarks:
This value represents the DPI that the barcode will be printed at. This value defaults to zero, which represents "logical" mode. In "logical" mode, the generated barcode represents the relative sizing and positioning of barcode elements, but they are not necessarily in the proper size for printing.
If the value is greater than zero, the barcode generator will generate a barcode using the specified DPI.
member.exception: When setting the DPI, the value specified was less than zero.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodeNSizer.WidthWithoutGuards
member.summary: The total width of the barcode, excluding any guard (quiet) zones, in pixels.
member.remarks: This method is overridden in derived classes, and must return the total width of the barcode data, given the current value of . The property is included so that the derived class can recieve information from its corresponding generator.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodeNSizer.Width
member.summary: The total width of the barcode, in pixels, given the current DPI and module width.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodeNSizer.Height
member.summary: The minimum height of the barcode, in pixels.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodeNSizer.ExtraHeight
member.summary: The height of all items added to the barcode.
member.value: The height of all items added to the barcode, in pixels.

remarks.para: For Code N barcodes, the only extra height comes from the text at the bottom of the barcode.

This property is meant to be used to generate a desired barcode height. To calculate the height of the size to pass to , multiply the desired height (in inches) by the DPI, and add this number to it. It is also important in aspect ratio calculations, as this value will be subtracted from the size passed to the generator, before checking the aspect ratio.
This property's value is potentially impacted by the value of . The barcode render mode flags should be set before using this value.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodeNSizer.Module
member.summary: Gets or sets the desired module width, in mils.
member.value: The current desired module width, in mils (1 mil is 1/1000th of an inch, .0254 mm). The default value is 10 mils (.33 mm).
member.remarks: The barcode generator will generate a barcode with a module width that is as close as possible to, but not smaller than, the specified module width, within the limits of the specified DPI. It cannot be set lower than the value returned by the implementation of the corresponding derived class.
member.exception: The specified module width is smaller than .

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodeNSizer.MinimumModule
member.summary: Gets the minimum module width, in mils.
member.value: The minimum module width, in mils. (1 mil is 1/1000th of an inch, or .025mm)

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The default module width. This should be greater than the value returned by the derived class's property, but this is not checked.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodeNGenerator.EncodedData
member.summary: Gets or sets the bit array that encodes the barcode pattern.
member.remarks: The default interpretation of this data (used in ) is a true bit corresponds with a dark bar one module wide, and a false is a space one module wide.

member.summary: Called on derived class to check data sent to the property.
member.remarks: If the specified data is invalid, the derived class should throw an exception.

member.summary: Called on a derived class when the derived class should encode its data into a barcode pattern.
member.remarks: This is called after the data is checked with .

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodeNGenerator.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text to be written below the barcode.
member.value: A string to display under the barcode.
member.remarks: This is normally set by the barcodes' corresponding generator or encoder, and should usually not be set directly. However, if the default human readable text is not sufficient, it can be changed. Note that the barcode sizer does not take the length of this text into account, nor does it support more than one line of text. While there is enough room to display the encoded data, the total amount of text displayable depends on many factors. The string is only displayed if the flag is set.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.CodeNGenerator.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded into a barcode pattern.
member.value: A byte array of the data to
member.remarks: This data is first checked by calling the derived class's implementation of , before it is saved. If the data is invalid, an will be thrown. This property saves a reference to the underlying array; it does not make a copy. The behavior if the underlying byte array is changed is undefined.
member.exception: The data specified was invalid.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.EAN13Encoder
member.summary: An encoder for EAN13 barcodes.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EAN13Encoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded into EAN13.
member.value: The string to be encoded, or null.
member.remarks: This property takes a string of exactly 12 or 13 digits, without spaces, dashes, or other separators. If the string is 12 digits long, the check digit will be calculated and appended automatically. If the string is 13 digits long, the check digit will be calculated and compared with the 13th digit. If they do not match, an will be thrown. The property may also be set to null.
member.exception: The specified string was not null, did not have 12 or 13 digits, was not composed of digits 0-9, or included an invalid check digit. The property will be "Length", "Digit", or "Check", respectively, depending on the error.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EAN13Encoder.Flags
member.summary: Returns the encoder capability flags./>

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EAN13Encoder.TextSymbols
member.summary: Returns the symbols that can be encoded.
member.remarks: The encoder can only encode digits. If any non-digit symbol is passed to the encoder, it will fail.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.EAN13Encoder.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor to construct a standard EAN13Encoder.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.EAN13Encoder.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Special constructor for use by .
member.param: If true, the generator will generate a UPCA barcode, which is very similar to an EAN13 barcode, but with the numbers placed in a slightly different manner, and only showing 12 digits instead of 13.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.UPCAEncoder
member.summary: An encoder for UPCA barcodes.
member.remarks: This encoder is functionally equivilent to , with the exception of using a special constructor and always prepending "0" to any UPC specified before passing it to the EAN13 encoder.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.UPCAEncoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded into UPCA.
member.value: The string to be encoded, or null.
member.remarks: This property takes a string of exactly 11 or 12 digits, without spaces, dashes, or other separators. If the string is 11 digits long, the check digit will be calculated and appended automatically. If the string is 12 digits long, the check digit will be calculated and compared with the 12th digit. If they do not match, an will be thrown. The property may also be set to null.
member.exception: The specified string was not null, did not have 11 or 12 digits, was not composed of digits 0-9, or included an invalid check digit. The property will be "Length", "Digit", or "Check", respectively, depending on the error.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.ISBNEncoder
member.summary: An encoder for ISBN barcodes.
member.remarks: This encoder is built on top of , checking the ISBN check digit and always prepending "978" to the ISBN before passing it to the EAN13 encoder.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ISBNEncoder.TextSymbols
member.summary: Returns the symbols that will be recognized by the encoder.
member.remarks: The encoder will ignore any symbol other than those listed above; however they will be passed on to the generator and appear in the ISBN number above the barcode.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ISBNEncoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the ISBN to be encoded.
member.value: The string to be encoded, or null.
member.remarks: This property takes an ISBN string. The ISBN is extracted by dropping all characters other than 0-9 and 'X' (case insensitive). The ISBN is then checked, and if it is valid, the underlying encoder is set. The upper text area of the barcode generator is set to include both the ISBN10 and ISBN13 numbers, if the barcode property includes the flag. The property may also be set to null.
member.exception: The specified string was not null and did not contain a 10 digit ISBN, had an 'X' in any position other than the check digit position, or the check digit was invalid. The property will be "Length", "X", or "Check", respectively, depending on the error.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.ISBN13Encoder
member.summary: An encoder for ISBN13 barcodes.
member.remarks: This encoder is built on top of , checking the ISBN check digit before passing it to the EAN13 encoder.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ISBN13Encoder.TextSymbols
member.summary: Returns the symbols that will be recognized by the encoder.
member.remarks: The encoder will ignore any symbol other than those listed above; however they will be passed on to the generator and appear in the ISBN13 number above the barcode.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ISBN13Encoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the ISBN13 to be encoded.
member.value: The string to be encoded, or null.
member.remarks: This property takes an ISBN13 string. The ISBN13 is extracted by dropping all characters other than 0-9. The ISBN13 is then checked, and if it is valid, the underlying encoder is set. The upper text area of the barcode generator is set to include the ISBN13 number, if the barcode property includes the flag. The property may also be set to null.
member.exception: The specified string was not null and did not contain a 13 digit ISBN, did not start with 978 or 979, or the check digit was invalid. The property will be "Length", "Start", or "Check", respectively, depending on the error.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.ISSNEncoder
member.summary: An encoder for ISSN barcodes.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.ISSNEncoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the ISSN to be encoded.

The ISSN is extracted by dropping all characters other than 0-9 and 'X' (case insensitive). The ISSN is then checked, and if it is valid, the underlying encoder is set. The property will be "Length", "X", or "Check", respectively, depending on the error.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.UPCEEncoder
member.summary: An encoder for UPCE barcodes.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.UPCEEncoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded into UPCE.
member.value: The string to be encoded, or null.

remarks.para: This property takes a string of exactly 7, 8, 11 or 12 digits, without spaces, dashes, or other separators. If the string is 7 digits long, the check digit will be calculated and appended automatically. If the string is 8 digits long, the check digit will be calculated and compared with the 8th digit. If they do not match, an will be thrown.

If the string is 11 or 12 digits long, it is treated as a UPCA barcode. The barcode is compressed into a UPCE barcode, if possible. The check digit is then appended or checked, if the input had 11 or 12 digits, respectively.
The property may also be set to null.

member.exception: The specified string was not null, did not have 7 or 8 digits, was not composed of digits 0-9, included an invalid check digit, or could not be converted into a UPCE barcode. The property will be "Length", "Digit", "Check", or "Invalid", respectively, depending on the error.

member.summary: Returns the encoder capability flags./>

member.summary: Returns the symbols that can be encoded.
member.remarks: The encoder can only encode digits. If any non-digit symbol is passed to the encoder, it will fail.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: An encoder for UPC+2 and UPC+5 addon barcodes.
member.remarks: This is a composite encoder; the generator will be null until the data to be encoded is specified.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.UPC25Encoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded into UPC+2 or UPC+5.
member.value: The string to be encoded, or null.
member.remarks: This property takes a string of exactly 2 or 5 digits, without spaces, dashes, or other separators. If the string is 2 digits long, the generator will be configured to generate a UPC+2 barcode. If the string is 5 digits long, the generator will be configured to generate a UPC+5 barcode. The property may also be set to null. As this is a composite encoder, and the generator depends on data being encoded, the property will return null if the data to be encoded has not been set, and the generator reference might change if the data to be encoded is changed.
member.exception: The specified string was not null, did not have 2 or 5 digits, or was not composed of digits 0-9. The property will be "Length" or "Digit", respectively, depending on the error.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer
member.summary: The sizing control class for all EAN-based barcodes.
member.remarks: All of the EAN-based barcode symbologies (EAN13, EAN8, UPCE, UPC+2, and UPC+5) have the same basic sizing requirements, with the only variation being in guard widths, notch sizes, etc.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructs a new
member.param: The width of the left guard, measured in modules.
The width of the right guard, measured in modules.
The total width of the barcode, excluding guards, measured in modules.
The total depth of the notch, measured in modules.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer.ModuleWidth
member.summary: Returns the current module width, in pixels.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer.LeftGuard
member.summary: Returns the left guard width, in pixels.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer.RightGuard
member.summary: Returns the right guard width, in pixels.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer.NotchDepth
member.summary: The distance from the top of the notch to the bottom of the barcode, in pixels.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer.BottomDepth
member.summary: The distance from the bottom of the barcode to the bottom of the bitmap, in pixels.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer.TopDepth
member.summary: The height of the upper blank zone above the barcode, in pixels.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer.FontHeight
member.summary: The font height to use for human readable decorations, in pixels.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer.Width
member.summary: The total width of the barcode, in pixels, given the current DPI and module width.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer.UpperLines
member.summary: The number of lines of text appearing above the barcode.
member.remarks: This value is set by .

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer.Height
member.summary: The minimum height of the barcode, in pixels.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer.ExtraHeight
member.summary: The height of all items added to the barcode.
member.value: The height of all items added to the barcode, in pixels.

remarks.para: For EAN-based barcodes, the extra height comes from the text at the top and bottom of the barcode. Note that the "extra height" is measured from the top of the notch (if present), not from the absolute bottom of the bars (the bars that hang down in the middle and on the edges).
This property is meant to be used to generate a desired barcode height. To calculate the height of the size to pass to , multiply the desired height (in inches) by the DPI, and add this number to it.
This property's value is potentially impacted by the value of . The barcode render mode flags should be set before using this value.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer.DPI
member.summary: The current DPI (dots-per-inch) of the barcode.
member.value: The current DPI (dots-per-inch) of the barcode.
member.remarks:
This value represents the DPI that the barcode will be printed at. This value defaults to zero, which represents "logical" mode. In "logical" mode, the generated barcode represents the relative sizing and positioning of barcode elements, but they are not necessarily in the proper size for printing.
If the value is greater than zero, the barcode generator will generate a barcode using the specified DPI.
member.exception: The value specified was less than zero

member.summary: Checks to see if a specified size is valid.
member.param: A size to test for validity.
member.returns: True if this size is valid, false otherwise.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer.GetValidSize(System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Given a size, returns the largest valid size contained by that size.
member.param: A maximum size, from which to find a valid size.
member.returns: A valid size.
member.exception: The specified size is smaller than the minimum size in one or both dimensions.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer.Mode
member.summary: The rendering mode flags, which control the way the barcode is rendered.
member.value: The flags which control which aspects of the barcode are rendered.
member.remarks: The flags which may be used are , , and . All other flags have no effect. If the flag is specified, the and are automatically set.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANSizer.Module
member.summary: Gets and sets module width of the barcode (in mils).
member.value: The module width of the barcode, in mils (1 mil=1/1000 of an inch).
member.remarks: The default value is 13 mils (.33 mm).
member.exception: The specified module width is less than .

member.summary: The minimum module width of the barcode (in mils).
member.remarks: The value of cannot be set lower than the value returned by this property.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANGenerator
member.summary: The base class for the EAN-based barcode generators.
member.remarks: This class implements the actual barcode generation method, and call the method in derived classes to add the notches and numbering to the barcode. It does not implement the property, nor does it handle storage of encoded data. That is the responsibility of derived classes. The only way this class accesses encoded data is via the method.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANGenerator.GenerateEncoding
member.summary: Called by to obtain the encoded module pattern.
member.returns: A containing the module pattern.
member.remarks: The returned bit array contains one bit for each module that makes up the width of the barcode itself (excluding guard zones). A true value is rendered as a dark bar, and a false value is a blank space.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANGenerator.Decorator(System.Drawing.Graphics,System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Called by to decorate the barcode with notches and numbering.
member.param: A graphics contexts containing the barcode.
The size of the barcode bitmap.
member.remarks: When this method is called, the barcode has been drawn into the graphics context, between two blank guard zones. The barcode itself stretches from the top to the bottom of the bitmap. It is the job of the decorator to trim the barcode the the dimensions specified by .

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANGenerator.Flags
member.summary: Gets the generator's capability flags.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANGenerator.GenerateBarcode(System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Generates a bitmap of the barcode, at a specified size.
member.param: The size of bitmap to generate.
member.returns: A bitmap of the barcode.
member.remarks:
The order of operations is as follows:
Check the and to ensure validity.
Call the method.
Using the data returned from step 2, generate a raw barcode bitmap.
Call the method.
Return the resulting bitmap.
member.exception: The specified was not valid.
The generator does not have any data set.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class, with the specified sizer.

member.summary: A generator for EAN13/UPCA barcodes.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EAN13Generator.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the byte array of encoded data used by the generator to generate the barcode.
member.value: The byte array of encoded data.
member.remarks: This data only has very basic validation to ensure that it does not cause exceptions when used (such as array overruns). It is not checked for validity. The user should not set this directly, instead, it should be set by an encoder class. This property does not make a copy of the byte array that is supplied to it, it only keeps a reference. Its behavior if the underlying array is modified, is undefined.
member.exception: The specified byte array is invalid, in either length or content. The property will be "Length" or "Data", respectively.

member.summary: Gets or sets the text to appear above the barcode.
member.value: The text to appear above the barcode.
member.remarks: The minimum height of the barcode will be increased, depending on the number of lines of text that are displayed. However, the width of the barcode will not be, so the length of the lines of text should be kept short.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANCompositeEncoder
member.summary: A compositing encoder, for producing composite EAN barcodes.
member.remarks: A composite EAN barcode is an EAN barcode, followed by a UPC+2 or UPC+5 barcode. The extra barcode is often used to provide supplemental information, such as price or issue number. The two barcodes must meet certain sizing requirements, including maximum distance between the two barcodes, and relative heights.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANCompositeEncoder.Data
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANCompositeEncoder.EncodedData
member.summary: Not supported.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EANCompositeEncoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the string to be encoded.
member.value: The string to be encoded, or null.
member.remarks:
The data to be encoded must be formated as follows:
'Mode' <Left Data>'/'<Right Data>
Mode is a single letter from the following list:
LetterLeft Barcode Type
'E'EAN13/EAN8
'M'UPCE
'I'ISBN/ISBN13
'S'ISSN
'U'UPCA
Left Data is the string that would be passed to the corresponding encoder's Text property.
Right Data is the string that would be passed to the UPC+2 or UPC+5 encoder's Text property. The two data strings are separated by a slash '/', with no spaces. The <, >, and ' are not used.
The string is converted to uppercase before processing.
member.exception: If there is an error in the formatting of the data string, this exception is thrown with its property set to "Length" or "Flag", if the formatting is invalid or the mode flag is unrecognized, respectively. If the left or right data is invalid, the exception's property will be "Left" or "Right", and the inner exception will be the exception thrown by the underlying encoder.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.EAN128Encoder
member.summary: An encoder to validate and generate EAN-128 barcodes.
member.remarks: EAN-128 is used in many trade-related situations, and can encode information such as manufacturer, serial numbers, dimensions, weights, etc. The complete specifications are available from the EAN/UCC. This particular class is based on the specifications presented in the EAN/UCC specification version 6.0. The encoder will check for properly formed data sequences, as defined by their Application Indicator (AI) codes, and then pass them on to the underlying Code128 encoder, after adding the proper FNC1 control characters.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EAN128Encoder.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the data to be encoded into an EAN-128 barcode.
member.value: A string of the data to be encoded, or null.

remarks.para: The string should be formatted in the standard EAN-128 format: "(##)xxxxxx", where ## is the Application Identifier (AI), and xxxxxx is the data corresponding to that AI. This string forms what is called an "Element String". You can pass in any number of element strings, concatenated together, without spaces or other marks between each element string.

The encoder first separates the supplied string into its component Element Strings. If the encoder fails to separate the supplied string into valid Element Strings, it will throw an with a of "Split". This phase also checks for well formed Element Strings, ensuring that the AI contains at least 2 and no more than 4 digits, and is contained in parenthesis, before the data to be encoded, and that the data does not contain invalid characters (as defined in the EAN/UCC specification, version 6, table 3.A.3 - 1.
Important Note: The data portion of the element string can, by EAN/UCC specification, contain parenthesis. However, this will confuse the encoder, since the AI must be in parenthesis. As such, when passing a data string that contains parenthesis to the encoder, the parenthesis must be converted to square brackets ('(' to '[' and ')' to ']'). The AI remains in parenthesis. When the barcode is generated, the square brackets will be converted back to parenthesis when they appear in the human-readable numbering below the barcode.

After it is separated, each individual element string is checked for validity, depending on the AI that is supplied. If the Element String is not valid, it will throw an with the property set to the element string that was invalid.

Once the element strings are checked, one final check is made to ensure that the total length of the barcode does not exceed 48 data symbols. This length is calculated by taking the total lengths of the element strings, (excluding the parenthesis that separate the AI from the data), plus any extra FNC1 codes that must be added to mark the end of a variable-length element string. (Variable length element strings are any strings with an AI that does not begin with 00-04, 11-20, 31-36, or 41. Note that not all of these AI's are defined as of EAN/UCC specification version 6.0, but their lengths have been defined.) If the length is over 48, the encoder will throw an with the set to "Length".

member.exception: There was an error encoding the specified string.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EAN128Encoder.Flags
member.summary: Gets flags that represent the encoder's capabilities.

member.name: P:ActiveUp.WebControls.EAN128Encoder.StandardSize
member.summary: Gets the size that will produce a barcode of the standardized size.
member.value: The standard size of the barcode.
member.remarks: This also performs numerous checks to ensure that the generated barcode will be within the specification. This includes checking that the DPI is not zero, that the module width is between 9.8 and 40 mils, and that the total length of the barcode does not exceed 6.5 inches (16.5 cm). If this property throws an , and the DPI is set and the module width is between 9.8 and 40 mils, then the barcode is too long to be encoded at the current module width, and the module width should be decreased.

member.name: M:ActiveUp.WebControls.EAN128Encoder.CalculateModule
member.summary: This is a convenience function, to calculate and set a valid module width.
member.remarks: This should be called if throws an . It will set the module width to a value that results in a barcode with a total width less than 6.5 inches.
member.exception: The function cannot calculate a valid module width; this shouldn't happen.
The DPI is set to zero.

member.name: T:ActiveUp.WebControls.HIBCEncoder
member.summary: A holding class, containing static methods that prepare barcode encoder instances.
member.remarks: The four static methods each return an array of one or two objects, the first representing the primary barcode, and the second, the secondary barcode, if one is requested. There are two standards used to encode HIBC data: the HIBC LIC (Labeler Identification Code), which consists of a LIC, a PCN (Product or Catalog Number) and a Unit of Measure digit; and the GS1, which uses an EAN/UCC assigned GS1 number, along with a Unit of Measure digit. These two primary data standards each carry their own encoding requirements and available symbologies, as described in their corresponding methods, and .
